entries.title: Seagrass Habitat in Florida
entries.description: This polygon GIS data set represents a compilation of statewide seagrass data from various source agencies and scales. The data were mapped from sources ranging in date from 1987 to 2016.

entries.title: Mangrove Habitat in Florida
entries.description: This GIS data set represents mangroves in Florida. The data are reselected from land use and land cover data from Florida's water management districts.

entries.title: Historic Harmful Algal Bloom Events 2007 - 2015
entries.description: GIS point shapefile of recent sampling locations for the phytoplankton that causes red tide, Karenia brevis. Sampling sites dates of this shapefile cover the calendar years 2007 through 2015. The HAB shapefile is a spatial representation of information gathered in the HAB Historical Database, which provides information on the presence and absence of Karenia brevis.

entries.title: Salt Marshes in Florida
entries.description: This GIS data set represents the saltwater marsh areas in Florida. The data are a compilation of available land use and land cover information mapped by Florida's water management districts. The most recent data available as of July 2012 are used; the photography dates are between 1999 and 2010.

entries.title: Florida Seagrass: Volusia, 2008
entries.description: This topographical map was created by FCIT and shows the seagrass distribution for Volusia County. The green coloration depicts continuous seagrass while the yellow shows discontinuous seagrass. In addition to the seagrass, rivers, towns, and highways are shown. Some of the towns are Daytona, Glencoe, and Deltona. The data used for this map was taken from a 1992 United States Geological Survey (USGS).
entries.source: Florida Center for Instructional Technology, Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission

entries.title: Florida Seagrass: Brevard, 2008
entries.description: This topographical map was created by FCIT and shows the seagrass distribution for Brevard County. The green coloration depicts continuous seagrass while the yellow shows discontinuous seagrass. In addition to the seagrass, rivers, towns, and highways are shown. Some of the towns are Cape Canaveral, Bellwood, and Titusville. The data used for this map was taken from a 1992 United States Geological Survey (USGS).
entries.source: Florida Center for Instructional Technology, Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission

Some of the towns are White City, Indrio, and Ankona. The data used for this map was taken from a 1992 United States Geological Survey (USGS).
entries.source: Florida Center for Instructional Technology, Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission

entries.title: Indian River Lagoon Aquatic Preserves Spoil Island Project
entries.description: Managed by the Florida Department of Environmental Proection (FDEP), the Indian River Lagoon Aquatic Preserve (IRLAP) Office oversees the Spoil Island Project. Through multi-agency cooperation and volunteer events, the IRLAP hosts cleanups, constructs recreational enhancements, removes exotics, and adds native plants to the islands.

entries.title: Water Quality Data in the Indian River Lagoon Area
entries.description: This data shows the water quality in Volusia, Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie, and Martin Counties.

entries.title: Manatee Yearly Mortality Summaries
entries.description: 1974 to 2016 yearly summaries of manatee deaths for the state of Florida.

entries.title: Indian River Lagoon Species Inventory
entries.description: An inventory of numerous species observed within the IRL.

entries.title: Volusia County Fishing docks and piers
entries.description: List of fishing docks and piers.
